business.headline: Sensex, Nifty close higher: Top gainers and losers, tariff impact and key driversStock market today: Some of the top gainers during today's session were Bajaj Finserv, IndusInd Bank, NTPC, L&T, Ultratech Cement, Hero MotoCorp, Adani Enterprises and BPCL. On the other hand, some of the top losers were Tata Motors, Sun Pharma, Eicher Motors, Apollo Hospitals, Bharti Airtel, Kotak Mahindra Bank and HCLTech.

Sensex ends 318 points higher, Nifty just below 23,600; Tata Motors down 5%Stock market closing bell: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 317.93 points higher at 77,606.43, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 105.10 points to settle at 23,591.95.

Noida, Greater Noida flat registration fees may rise 20-30%According to a draft notification, circle rates in Noida could see a 20% hike, while in Greater Noida, the increase may go up to 30%. The move is expected to make property transactions more expensive in the region.

India may receive reprieve from proposed US tariffs: SourcesIndia may escape the proposed US tariffs and avoid being grouped with nations like China, Mexico, and Canada, according to government sources. Trade talks between the two countries are progressing smoothly, with no signs of a deadlock as the April 2 deadline for US reciprocal tariffs approaches.

RBI may double foreign individual investor limit to 10% in listed firms: ReportForeign portfolio investors (FPIs), pressured by poor earnings, high valuations and prospects of U.S. tariffs, have pulled more than $28 billion out of Indian stocks since September's record high in the benchmark NSE Nifty 50.

Elon Musk leads Hurun Global Rich List despite $100 billion drop in net worthElon Musk has reretained his position as the wealthiest person in the world for the fourth time in five years, becoming the first individual to surpass the $400 billion threshold, noted the Hurun Research report.

US tariff reprieve for India, may not be treated like China, Canada, Mexico: SourcesTrade talks between the two nations are progressing smoothly, with no deadlock expected before the April 2 deadline for US reciprocal tariffs.

Infosys terminates more trainees from Mysuru campus, but offers…: ReportInfosys has terminated more trainees from its Myrusu campus. The IT giant had terminated hundreds of trainees from the same campus just two months ago.

Tata Motors shares slump as US slaps 25% duty on car importsTata Motors stock price: Tata Motors shares slumped 6% in early trade and were trading 5.26% lower at Rs 670.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 9.55 am.

Sensex, Nifty gain after opening lower in volatile trade; Wipro rises nearly 2%Stock market opening: While the Sensex opened 100 points lower, it was trading 64.27 points higher at 77,552.77 at around 9.26 am. The Nifty50 was trading 16.75 points higher at 23,503.60.

Top stocks to watch today: Tata Motors, Wipro, JB Chemicals, Infosys, Vedanta, UPLWhile positive cues are likely to support the two leading indices on Dalal Street, US tariff uncertainty looms large. Here are some of the key stocks that will be in focus today.

Stock market on March 27: What to expect from Sensex, Nifty today?Stock market prediction: Nifty and Sensex have gained nearly 2% in the past five sessions, but investors will now be watching to see if the market can recover from Wednesday's drop.

entertainment.headline: Scooby-Doo live-action series greenlit by NetflixWe have some good news for Scooby-Doo fans. The beloved cartoon is getting the live-action treatment by streaming giant Netflix.

Santosh director calls censor board's ban on film's release heartbreakingSantosh director Sandhya Suri reacted to the film's India being blocked by the censor board. This came after the board demanded extensive and widespread cuts.

Exclusive: Prabhas's team breaks silence on rumours of his weddingIt was rumoured that Telugu superstar Prabhas is finally settling down in life and that he was going to marry the daughter of a businessman. His team responded to the rumours regarding his marriage.

Ji Chang-wook, Son Ye-jin's period drama is finally in production, confirms NetflixNetflix is set to produce 'Scandals', a Korean drama inspired by the 2003 film 'Untold Scandal'. Starring Son Ye-jin, Ji Chang-wook, and Nana, this series explores love and power in the Joseon era.

Dabboo Ratnani on Rekha's new photoshoot: We wrapped up in 20 minutesCelebrity photographer Dabboo Ratnani reveals Rekha called him for a personal shoot. They wrapped up in 20 minutes but spent an hour chatting. The legendary actor was deeply involved in styling, planning every detail.

Aamir Khan vs Salman Khan: Who's the better dancer, Sikandar director respondsBollywood superstars Salman Khan and Aamir Khan recently sat down to discuss the making of Sikandar with director AR Murugadoss. During their chat, the filmmaker answered a number of questions, including who is the better dancer of the two.

Aamir shares Laapataa Ladies audition, fans say Ravi Kishan was 'perfect choice'Aamir Khan shares his audition for Laapataa Ladies. Fans agree Kiran Rao made the right call by casting Ravi Kishan, praising his 'authenticity' and saying Aamir looked 'too elite' for the role.

Deva OTT release: When and where to watch Shahid Kapor, Pooja Hegde's actionerActors Shahid Kapoor and Pooja Hegde's action-thriller Deva is gearing up for its OTT release. The film, directed by Rosshan Andrrews, will premiere on Netflix.

L2 Empuraan review: Convenient writing aside, Mohanlal-Prithviraj actioner deliversReleased-Thu Mar 27, 2025L2 Empuraan movie review: Director Prithviraj Sukumaran's Empuraan is a fitting sequel to Lucifer. Mounted on a grand scale, the film displays convenient writing but makes up with stunning visuals.

Salman Khan flaunts Ram Janmabhoomi watch worth Rs 61 lakh, fans reactAhead of the release of his film Sikandar, Salman Khan was seen promoting the film flaunting his luxurious limited-edition Ram Janmabhoomi watch worth Rs 61 lakh. Fans reacted to the pictures, praising his secularism.

Stop dumbing down films, audiences are smarter than you think: Adarsh GouravIn an exclusive interview with India Today, actor Adarsh Gourav reacted to Hansal Mehta calling him a 'chameleon'. He urged Bollywood to take risks, criticised the obsession with box office numbers, and said filmmakers should stop underestimating audiences.

Salman Khan on working with Ananya, Janhvi: Difficult when people talk about age gapSalman Khan expressed his willingness to work with younger actors like Ananya Panday and Janhvi Kapoor, despite facing criticism over the age gap. He believes collaborating with them provides valuable opportunities for their careers.

Tamil actor Shruthi Narayanan shares post after alleged casting couch video leakTamil actor Shruthi Narayanan is back in public view on Instagram after a casting couch video allegedly featuring her was leaked online. She had briefly made her Instagram account private.

Salman Khan on South vs Bollywood: Their audience isn't very accepting of our filmsSalman Khan recently discussed the popularity of South Indian films and the fan following enjoyed by the actors there. The actors cited 
 fewer theatres in Bollywood as compared to the South to recover costs.

Neha Kakkar on being booed at Melbourne concert: Wait for the truthSinger Neha Kakkar addressed her recent Melbourne incident where she broke down after arriving three hours late for the concert. In a social media post, Kakkar asked fans to 'wait for the truth' to come out.

Actor Vikram's Veera Dheera Sooran release delayed due to legal issuesThe release of actor Vikram's upcoming film Veera Dheera Sooran has been affected, with shows cancelled at the last minute. The Delhi High Court has imposed an interim stay, halting the film's release for the next four weeks.

Actor Michael Caine was 'terrified' of Heath Ledger on Dark Knight setVeteran actor Michael Caine has praised Heath Ledger's dedication to his craft in the memoir, Don't Look Back, You'll Trip Over: My Guide to Life. The actors worked together in Dark Knight.

Ram Charan turns 40: Jr NTR, Mahesh Babu and actors share sweet birthday wishesActor Ram Charan marked his 40th birthday on March 27. On the special day, actors, including Mahesh Babu, Jr NTR, Janhvi Kapoor, and Chiranjeevi, extended heartwarming wishes.

Intimate messages between Kim Soo-hyun and Kim Sae-ron from 2016 leaked: ReportA bunch of intimate messages allegedly exchanged between K-drama actors Kim Soo-hyun and Kim Sae-ron have been shared by the late actor's family during a recent press meet.

general news.headline: 'Now it's our turn': Putin to visit India soon, first since start of Ukraine warThis will be the first visit by Vladimir Putin, who has cultivated close ties with PM Modi, since the war with Ukraine broke out in 2022.

Congress workers attempt to gherao Odisha Assembly, police use water cannonCongress workers clashed with police in Odisha after 14 party MLAs were suspended for disrupting House proceedings. Water cannons were used as protests escalated.

Rohit Sharma likely to opt out of England tour, Virat Kohli to retain spotSources told India Today that Rohit Sharma might not feature in India's upcoming Test series against England to be held later this year. But Virat Kohli is most likely to retain his spot.

Yogi Adityanath lecturing us on hate? The irony: Stalin hits back in language rowTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin hit back at his Uttar Pradesh counterpart for criticising the DMK's stand on delimitation and language policy, calling the BJP's response hypocritical and dubbing it "political black comedy at its darkest".

Pakistan rattled as Baloch women turn suicide bombersIt was a woman suicide bomber of the BLA's elite Majeed Brigade who blew herself in Kalat recently, causing death and destruction to the Pakistani army. Once silent victims, Baloch women from diverse backgrounds are now at the forefront of a growing resistance against the joint exploitation of Balochistan by Pakistan and China. Here's what's driving this trend.

CBSE cracks down on dummy schools, may barred students from board examsClass 12 students enrolled in dummy schools may face restrictions on appearing for board exams, as per CBSE officials. The board emphasised that both students and parents share the responsibility for ensuring regular school attendance.

Salman Khan on death threats: Life lately is home, shooting films, homeSalman Khan, who has received several death threats, said he believes in God and will live as long as destined. However, he finds heavy security challenging at times.

Ranya Rao denied bail again in gold smuggling case, may approach High CourtKannada actor Ranya Rao's bail plea was rejected by the Sessions Court in the gold smuggling case. The court cited international links, customs violations, and the risk of evidence tampering as key reasons for denial.

Political remarriage of AIADMK-BJP on the cards but relationship status remains complicatedEdappadi Palaniswami, the AIADMK boss, met Home Minister Amit Shah ostensibly to discuss the law and order situation in Tamil Nadu on March 25.

Forty-one percent of Indian-Americans said the 2024 election strengthened India's democracy. PM Modi's rating remains stable among the respondents.

KKR beat Rajasthan by eight wickets in their second match.

IPL 2025: Four uncapped stars who shone in first weekThe first week of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) has seen several young stars rise to the limelight with their marvellous performances. Here's a look at the top four uncapped players who managed to grab the attention of fans:

Iga Swiatek stunned by Rafael Nadal Academy 19-year-old graduateMiami Open 2025: After beating Jelana Ostapenko and Madison Keys, 19-year-old wildcard from Philippines Alexandra Eala has beaten Iga Swiatek to book a berth in the semi-final of the tournament.

Quinton de Kock 2.0? South African star shows KKR can be spicy without SaltQuinton de Kock seems to have found a new lease of life in KKR, while doing one of the toughest jobs for the defending IPL champions. While replacing Phil Salt may not be possible, the experienced South African adds a different spicy flavour to the KKR side.

Virat Kohli mania in Chennai: RCB star signs autographs, trains for spin challengeIPL 2025, CSK vs RCB: Virat Kohli thrilled fans in Chennai by signing autographs after an intense training session ahead of RCB's clash against CSK. The star batter focused on countering CSK's spin threat, preparing for challenges from Noor Ahmad, R Ashwin, and Ravindra Jadeja.

SRH vs LSG: Will SunRisers Hyderabad smash IPL's first 300 today?IPL 2025, SRH vs LSG: SunRisers Hyderabad are on the brink of making IPL history by becoming the first team to score 300 runs in an innings, following their explosive start to the 2025 season. With a power-packed batting line-up and a struggling Lucknow Super Giants bowling attack, all eyes are on Thursday's showdown in Hyderabad.

Points Table, March 26: Kolkata Knight Riders climb standings after Guwahati winIPL Points Table Update, March 26: Kolkata Knight Riders jumped to the sixth spot after a good boost to their Net Run Rate following their 8-wicket win over Rajasthan Royals on Wednesday.

NBA: Stephen A. Smith is on a Taylor Swift tour run right now, says LeBron James over Bronny controversyLos Angeles Lakers superstar LeBron James reignited the fight with ESPN's Stephen A. Smith, taking a sharp jab at the sports commentator during an appearance on The Pat McAfee Show on Wednesday, March 26.

IPL 2025: Second ball rule applied for the  first time in RR vs KKRRajasthan Royals became the first IPL team to use the second ball rule in 2025, but it was not enough to prevent an eight-wicket defeat to Kolkata Knight Riders, led by Quinton de Kock's unbeaten 97 on a slow Guwahati pitch.

Quinton de Kock downplays retirement impact after record 97 for KKR vs RRIPL 2025, RR vs KKR: Quinton de Kock showed glimpses of vintage form with a record-breaking 97 off just 61 balls. On a sluggish pitch, the South African veteran stood out, helping KKR comfortably chase down 152 in Guwahati on Wednesday.

No Sunil Narine, no problem for KKR: Moeen Ali steps up vs RRMoeen Ali stepped up in Sunil Narine's absence, producing a brilliant 2/23 spell as KKR defeated Rajasthan Royals by eight wickets to claim their first IPL 2025 victory, with Quinton de Kock's unbeaten 97 sealing the win in Guwahati.

De Kock and spinners get KKR off the mark as RR stumble at Riyan's homeIPL 2025, RR vs KKR: Quinton de Kock's unbeaten 97 and a spin-bowling masterclass from Varun Chakravarthy and Moeen Ali helped Kolkata Knight Riders outclass Rajasthan Royals by eight wickets. Rajasthan, playing in Riyan Parag's hometown, suffered their second successive defeat of the season.

Watch: Riyan Parag fan invades pitch in Guwahati, touches RR star's feetIPL 2025, RR vs KKR: A fan breached security and invaded the pitch to catch a glimpse of Riyan Parag, who was leading Rajasthan Royals in his hometown, Guwahati. However, Rajasthan put on a disappointing display.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
